comments.content: Never mind… I recreated it. Thank you

Try Quiggley Wiggly by Nick Curtis:

[http://moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/curtis/pages/q\_r.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329200126/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/curtis/pages/q_r.htm)

Yes. It was called Quiggley Wiggly.  
Seems to have vanished from both Nick’s Fonts and myfonts.com.
CybaPee got Nick’s permission to post all his freeware fonts at TypOasis

Quiggley Wiggly is really a digitization of a typeface called ‘Holly’, according to the Solotype Catalog. I think there are other digitizations of it as well.

- Mike Yanega

It’s available as Holly both from URW and on the 24 Script and Cursive Display Fonts CD from Dover. Both of those, however have the original’s lower x-height. For that reason, I think that only Quigley Wiggly is a match. That t, by the way, appears to have been made from parts of QW’s T and the l or t.
